instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal screen not working
threads.message:
Hi, I have this machine where the internal video doesn't work, but I get the external video, I've already found myself in similar situations, and the damage seems to be a CPU data line.
I get <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR_BUF_EN</SIGNAL>,
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0SW_LCD_R</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>DP_INT_HPD</SIGNAL> with their nominal value, the measurement was made with the screen connected, the thing that stopped me is the measurement in positive diode to ground mode of <SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> = 0.0016
no damage evident liquid j8500 in good condition

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal screen not working
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>EDP_INT_AUX_N</SIGNAL> = 0.0016"
Is this without LCD connected?
Then CPU's eDP output is fried...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> internal screen not working
threads.message: Both with lcd connected and disconnected
